bibl.title: Military Orders for Jefferson Randolph Kean and Alexander N. Stark, March 7, 1901

div1.p: Special Orders #54 directs Kean to Columbia Barracks in order to relieve Stark. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Jefferson Randolph Kean and Alexander N. Stark, March 7, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, March 7, 1901.

Major Jefferson R. Kean, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers,
is hereby relieved from duty at these Headquarters, and
will proceed to Columbia Barracks, Cuba, and report to the
commanding officer for duty as surgeon, relieving Major
Alexander N. Stark, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers, and receipt-
ing to him for all public property for which he is responsible.

Upon being thus relieved Major Stark will comply with
paragraph 35, Special Orders No. 46, current series, Head-
quarters of the Army.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
